Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to James Bond — with one foot in the grave. After entering kidney failure, he agrees to one final hit. The target is an 80-year-old millionaire. He must now battle with cancerous crabs and lap-dancing twins, without losing either his sense of humour or his Medicare.

This is probably the only female Ninja movie ever made. It's great as a B film and the action sequences are a lot of fun to watch. This is a well invested crowdfunded project and I definitely appreciate the effort put into making it.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts our social history at the beginning of the Showa period when the ideological rule of Imperial Japan collapsed. This film also communicates a story of a nation which strongly held discordant views on weakness, sins, good and evil, and salvation.
